abstract.para: The &dapslong; can be installed and used on any Linux distribution. Because &dapsacr; was originally developed by the SUSE documentation team for managing their documentation projects, it is available as RPM package for the &osuse; distribution (and the &sle; products based on &osuse;). Eventually, RPM packages for further distributions may become available. In the meantime, you can download a tarball with the &dapsacr; sources taroth 2012-03-07: add from where: http://daps.sourceforge.net??? and install them on any distribution with configure, make, and make install.

sect1.title: Installing &dapsacr; on &osuse;
sect1.para: For &osuse;, the daps package is available from the Documentation:Tools repository at . For the complete path to the repository, you need to add the version number of your &osuse; installation. For example, the complete repository URL for &osuse; 12.1 would be:
For basic details on how to add software repositories and how to install software on &osuse;, refer to the &osuse; Reference Guide. The guide is part of the &osuse; documentation and available from .
Choose one of the following installation methods:

listitem.para: Follow the instructions in the &osuse; Reference Guide, chapter Installing Packages from the Internet. Search for the daps package that matches your &osuse; version. From the listed results, install the package that is provided by the repository Documentation:Tools.

sect1.para: All of the installation methods above automatically resolve any dependencies to other packages that are required by &dapsacr;.

sect1.title: Installing &dapsacr; on Other Linux Distributions
sect1.para: For installation on other Linux distributions, the &dapsacr; sources are available as tarball.taroth 2012-03-07: from??? They can be installed with configure, make, and make install as described in .
Before starting the installation, make sure the following packages or tools are installed on your system:

listitem.para: xmlcatalog (usually part of the package libxml2, libxml-utils, or libxml-tools)
xmllint (usually part of the package libxml2, libxml-utils, or libxml-tools)
xsltproc (if not available as a separate package, it may be included in libxslt)
